_header: Hail Jesu Gods Son in form of bread
_description: A prayer at the Levacion — twenty-six irregular lines

BLRoy17Cxvii.First Lines:
Hayle Iesu Godys Sone in forme of bredborne of mary withowtyn
                    synþoue sawe me ihesu fro endeles dede& þe to worcheppe
                    lat me neuer blyn…
BLRoy17Cxvii.Last Lines:
…Lorde ihesu […] [?henne ward] ay lastyng blys [þou
                    putte me in]? Amen
BLRoy17Cxvii.Note:
Written as prose and affected by damp, rendering the final lines
                    illegibl; partially recovered using a cold light source.
BLRoy17Cxvii.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Levation Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Modern Philology
         40 (1942): 131-46: 136-7.
